text: In life we shall find many men that are great, and some that are good, but very few men that are both great and good.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

text: The duty of comedy is to correct men by amusing them.
author: Moliere

text: Nothing is as peevish and pedantic as men's judgments of one another.
author: Desiderius Erasmus

text: Men's arguments often prove nothing but their wishes.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

text: Pride, envy, avarice - these are the sparks have set on fire the hearts of all men.
author: Dante Alighieri
